evidence: This projection is a one-dimensional profile
The Radon transform is used to collect x-ray projections.
The 1D Fourier transform is applied to each projection.
The 2D Fourier transform is used to reconstruct the original image.
The inverse process is used to reconstruct the original image from the projections.
The Fourier space is captured by rotating the data acquisition system.
The Fourier analysis connects the data from the physical object to the Fourier spectrum of the underlying image.

By changing the angle θ, we rotate the data acquisition system to gather x-ray projections. ... by perform the 1D Fourier trans of each and every of the 1D projections, we move into the Fourier domain.
